task_summary: Pick up the beige bottle visually resembling a milk container from the tabletop using a side grasp and lift it safely off the surface before retreating slightly. [attached_file:1]

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator operates over a white table with several small bottles, cans, and cups; the most carton-like milk item is a beige cylindrical bottle near the center-right, so the plan targets this as the milk container surrogate. The robot opens the gripper, localizes the target, approaches from above, computes a side grasp, closes to secure, lifts, verifies hold, and retreats to clear the clutter. Visual evidence indicates cluttered neighbors including a red can and blue cups, requiring precise alignment. [attached_file:1]
preconditions: Workspace is static and reachable; target 'milk_bottle' is visible on the table. [attached_file:1]
Gripper is functional and empty at start. [attached_file:1]
Collision model accounts for nearby can, cups, and bottles. [attached_file:1]
stepwise_plan: Open gripper, detect the 'milk_bottle' in the scene. [attached_file:1]
Move above the object with small vertical offset and align precisely. [attached_file:1]
Compute a side grasp pose to avoid top obstructions and approach the computed pose. [attached_file:1]
Close the gripper, lift the object, verify stability, and retreat slightly. [attached_file:1]
success_criteria: Object firmly in gripper confirmed by ObjectInGripper and stable after lift. [attached_file:1]
End-effector holds the bottle off the table with a small clearance and no collision. [attached_file:1]
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails or is occluded by nearby items, repeat perception and micro-adjust approach. [attached_file:1]
If grasp slips due to cylindrical geometry, recompute grasp with adjusted approach and retry after retreat. [attached_file:1]
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful verification of grasp and a short retreat creating safe clearance. [attached_file:1]

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear lowering toward the beige bottle with wrist alignment visible, indicating imminent grasp. [attached_file:1]
frame_3.predicts_next: Suggests gripper closure and lifting will follow in subsequent frames. [attached_file:1]
frame_3.uncertainty_reduction: High because end-effector pose relative to the target is well defined. [attached_file:1]

node_specs.description: Prepare the gripper for approach by opening to receive the bottle. [attached_file:1]
Detect and localize the milk_bottle in the tabletop scene. [attached_file:1]
Move to a pregrasp pose above the bottle with small vertical clearance. [attached_file:1]
Align end-effector laterally for a precise side grasp in clutter. [attached_file:1]
Compute a feasible side-grasp pose and store it as goal_pose. [attached_file:1]
Execute the computed grasp trajectory toward the bottle. [attached_file:1]
Close fingers to secure the cylindrical bottle with moderate force. [attached_file:1]
Lift the grasped bottle to clear the surface. [attached_file:1]
Verify the intended object is actually held. [attached_file:1]
Back off slightly to a safe pose with the object. [attached_file:1]

failure_modes: Target not detected due to occlusion by adjacent can or cups. [attached_file:1]
Grasp slip on smooth cylindrical surface during lift. [attached_file:1]
Collision with nearby objects during lateral alignment. [attached_file:1]
recovery_strategy: Re-attempt detection from a slightly different above-table pose and re-align. [attached_file:1]
Recompute grasp with adjusted side approach and retry after a short retreat. [attached_file:1]
Open gripper, retreat, and re-approach with tighter tolerance if contact occurs. [attached_file:1]
assumptions: No true rectangular milk carton is visible; the beige bottle is treated as the milk container per visual evidence, overriding the literal instruction. [attached_file:1]

expected_success_criteria: Bottle is lifted clear of the table and verified in gripper after retreat. [attached_file:1]
